answerText: MillerUrey experiment [accept names in either order][10] Juan Oro performed a follow-up experiment to the MillerUrey experiment showing that reacting ammonia and water with hydrogen cyanide could make amino acids and this compound.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | NYU - Kentucky B | 17 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This experiment successfully created sugars and amino acids from water, methane, ammonia, and hydrogen cyanide. For 10 points each: [10] Name this doubly-eponymous experiment which showed that it might be possible to create life from the conditions of early Earth.
